questions.question: This traditional Mesoamerican dish is made of masa which is steamed in a corn husk or banana leaf.
These translucent balls are produced from a starch extracted from the cassava root.
This spice, derived from the flower of Crocus sativus, has long been the world's most costly spice by weight.
This unleavened bread is an integral part of the Jewish festival of Passover.
This pizza from Naples is made with tomatoes, mozzarella, fresh basil, salt, and olive oil. It is named in honor of an Italian queen.
